item.title: HA-663: Detect lead duplication across different sources
item.description:
Reporter Andrey Chorniy (andrey.chorniy)
Created Aug 14, 2014 1:03:36 PM
Updated Aug 28, 2014 3:21:37 PM
Priority Normal
Type Task
State In Progress
Assignee Nikolay Chorniy (nikolay.chorniy@gmail.com)
Subsystem No subsystem
Fix versions 2.2
Affected versions 2.1
Fixed in build Next Build
aggregatetimespent No aggregatetimespent
aggregatetimeestimate No aggregatetimeestimate
resolution No resolution
timespent No timespent
timeestimate No timeestimate
Problem: There are the cases when different sources has similar (duplicate jobs)
http://insidehire.com/lead/53eb1529e4b0b6b12d015c04_524d7e2476ec77212be0a7f9
http://insidehire.com/lead/53eac0e9e4b0b6b12d015462_524d7e2476ec77212be0a7f9

System should autodetect that and show only one posting instead. System should maintain the links to the "duplicates" from different sources in the job-posting which will not be filtered out and show them as additional source icons in the "job-posting" - that icns will be a links to that "filtered" job-postings.

Notes:
  1. on the moment system do not have full-descriptions for both sourcesto compare (we may need to extract them from HTML for any source)
  2. Indeed have short description and we really do not extract job-details from Indeed postings. We need to extract full job-description out of job-details page

item.title: HA-680: need a simplified way to get back to the Feed, Candidate Lead or Workspace Column and last page left off at after creating a new contact
item.description:
Reporter Darren Mabashov (dmabashov)
Created Aug 25, 2014 4:05:20 PM
Updated Aug 28, 2014 3:19:15 PM
Priority Normal
Type Bug
State In Progress
Assignee Nikolay Chorniy (nikolay.chorniy@gmail.com)
Subsystem No subsystem
Fix versions 2.2
Affected versions 2.2
Fixed in build Next Build
aggregatetimespent No aggregatetimespent
aggregatetimeestimate No aggregatetimeestimate
resolution No resolution
timespent No timespent
timeestimate No timeestimate
In order to get back to the page the user left off at on the Feed, Candidate Lead or Workspace Column after creating new contacts, the user needs to hit the back button multiple times or hit the "home" (spider) icon button to get back to the home screen where they will have to search for the exact page the user left off at.

we need to simply this so the user has a very simple way to get back to the same page of the Feed, Candidate Lead, or Workspace tabs they left off at after a new contact has been created.

screencast attached.

Created Aug 28, 2014 10:55:14 AM

Priority Normal

resolution No resolution
timespent No timespent
timeestimate No timeestimate
There are a lot of them to choose from. They will monitor our logs and allow us to get reports, view them, and integrate with Slack.

Here are some candidates (feel free to add):

  • Loggly
  • Splunk
  • LogEntries

There are others for sure. All 3 of these are cloud-based. We want to try them of course.

item.title: HA-685: we want to relabel "Trash" into "Archive"
item.description:
Reporter Darren Mabashov (dmabashov)
Created Aug 27, 2014 3:04:22 PM
Updated Aug 28, 2014 10:46:01 AM
Priority Normal
Type Story
State Open
Assignee Unassigned
Subsystem No subsystem
Fix versions 2.2
Affected versions Unknown
Fixed in build Next Build
aggregatetimespent No aggregatetimespent
aggregatetimeestimate No aggregatetimeestimate
resolution No resolution
timespent No timespent
timeestimate No timeestimate
We want the "trash" section to be labeled as Archive and have the following functionality:

1. have it fully searchable in all categories (feed, candidate leads, workspace)

2. When a user closes / archives a lead that is not complete it will not go to the archive section but will be queued up to the Team Manager's Dashboard (see ticket # ) for approval.

a. this lead will not disappear out of the feed, candidate leads or other users workspace, but it will be easily identifiable that the lead is "archive pending" to all users. ID markers could be a that the lead is a different color, grayed out, or some type of distinguishing marker.

3. If a user closes / archives a lead that is complete it can go to the archive section without team manager approval but will also alert the Team Manager in the dashboard that a completed lead (team manager can also see which lead it was) has been archived.

4. any archived lead needs to have a visible date stamped on it as to when the lead was sent to the team manager for approval. This date needs to be stamped while the lead is subject to approval and when the lead get archived as well the date reflected will be the date that it was sent to the team manager for approval.

5. We still need a way to trash non-relevant leads. I am thinking when a user closes out a lead a prompt will come up asking the user "do you want to archive this lead or trash this lead"

a. trash will just trash it
b. archive will prompt complete or not completed.

item.title: AIA-19: Need to make a monitor Agent
item.description:
Reporter Rob Williams (rob)
Created Aug 23, 2014 7:34:43 AM
Updated Aug 28, 2014 10:42:50 AM
Priority Normal
Type Task
State Open
Assignee Unassigned
Subsystem Services
Fix versions 0.0.2
Affected versions Unknown
Fixed in build Next Build
So on JobSpider, we are constantly deploying builds only to have the Customer tell us later that no data is coming through.

We need to write a simple monitor that counts the # of items found, imported, geocoded, etc., and then posts a message into the channel from time-to-time.

This agent should also have the ability to detect idle periods that are too long, so for example post a message if we have not seen any new items in 5 hours.

item.title: HA-681: need new user categories
item.description:
Reporter Darren Mabashov (dmabashov)
Created Aug 26, 2014 2:50:44 PM
Updated Aug 28, 2014 10:42:49 AM
Priority Normal
Type Story
State Open
Assignee Unassigned
Subsystem No subsystem
Fix versions 2.2
Affected versions Unknown
Fixed in build Next Build
aggregatetimespent No aggregatetimespent
aggregatetimeestimate No aggregatetimeestimate
resolution No resolution
timespent No timespent
timeestimate No timeestimate
Users:

1.    Administrator

a.    Ability to make system wide changes
b.    All agencies and teams are visible
c.    Add / Delete Agency Manager, Team Manager and Team users
d.    Full functional abilities of all below users


2.    Agency Manager

a.    All teams within agency are visible
b.    Ability to create / delete new Team and/or Team Manager user and Team users
c.    Ability to add / delete Keywords determining relevancy of leads for teams in that agency
d.    Full Functional abilities of all below users


3.    Team Manager

a.    Add / delete members of that specific team
b.    Ability to approve / dis-approve team members (archival or “thumbs down” of candidate leads, workspace leads and feed leads
c.    Ability to approve / dis-approve what leads get dispatched or are taken out of the dispatcher
d.    Ability to trash feed and candidate leads in that team
e.    Full Functional abilities of all below users


4.    Team User

a.    Add / delete leads only in their workspace
b.    Ability to change their password
c.    Ability to add / delete contacts
d.    Ability to merge companies
e.    Ability to edit company / lead information pages
f.    Do not call and (thumbs down and/or archive)

item.title: HA-670: Companies are complaining we are calling them too much
item.description:
Reporter Darren Mabashov (dmabashov)
Created Aug 18, 2014 1:49:04 PM
Updated Aug 28, 2014 10:18:25 AM
Priority Normal
Type Story
State Open
Assignee Unassigned
Subsystem No subsystem
Fix versions 2.2
Affected versions Unknown
Fixed in build Next Build
aggregatetimespent No aggregatetimespent
aggregatetimeestimate No aggregatetimeestimate
resolution No resolution
timespent No timespent
timeestimate No timeestimate
there are certain leads that end up getting called too much from different members on the team and the company ends up getting upset at us. In some cases they have sent us pre-legal cease and desist orders.

There system needs to have the following functionality:

1. label a company "do not call"
a. all leads associated with that company will be "greyed out" or something where any user can clearly identify not to call that company

2. Label a Contact that is associated with a Lead "do not call"
a. only the contact marked "do not call" should be clearly identified. all other contacts will be ok to continue to call

3. Team Manager over ride
a. the team manager user will have the ability to un-label a company or a contact off the "do not call" list

Fix versions 2.1
Affected versions Unknown
Fixed in build Next Build
aggregatetimespent No aggregatetimespent
aggregatetimeestimate No aggregatetimeestimate
resolution No resolution
timespent No timespent
timeestimate No timeestimate
We need a new instance for deploying a backend for Job Spider. It will be responsible for performing address geocoding and job posting scraping. None of these tasks requires storing data on disk, so the new instance does not have to have a lot of disk capacity. It has to run many processes in parallel though, so instance needs at least 2 CPUs.

We reviewed EC2 instance types with their pricing and think that 'c3.large' instance with 3.75 GiB of memory and 2 virtual CPUs will be a good fit.

item.title: AIA-8: Need to parse different change types
item.description:
Reporter Rob Williams (rob)
Created Jul 30, 2014 12:00:41 PM
Updated Aug 27, 2014 4:19:00 PM
Priority Normal
Type Bug
State Submitted
Assignee Rob Williams (rob)
Subsystem No subsystem
Fix versions 0.0.2
Affected versions Unknown
Fixed in build Next Build
There are different types of changes. Most of them are of the simple form: 

 <user> changed <field> from <prior value> to <new value>

but relations are different and are triggered by different types.

item.title: AIA-26: Got too many extra updates on issues
item.description:
Reporter Andrey Chorniy (andrey.chorniy)
Created Aug 26, 2014 1:17:48 PM
Updated Aug 27, 2014 4:19:00 PM
Priority Normal
Type Bug
State Open
Assignee Unassigned
Subsystem No subsystem
Fix versions 0.0.2
Affected versions Unknown
Fixed in build Next Build
After version has been changed we got a lot of updates in the slack channel. Most of them are repeating each other (text). It looks like a lot of them was not reported before, but after version update they appear in tha channel with extra changes which should not be reported

For example here only last message should appear
nikolay.chorniy@gmail.com* updated HA-650: Add ability to search by candidate name

bot [9:22 PM]
*nikolay.chorniy@gmail.com* updated HA-650: Add ability to search by candidate name

bot [9:22 PM]
*nikolay.chorniy@gmail.com* updated HA-650: Add ability to search by candidate name

bot [9:22 PM]

bot [9:22 PM]

*dmabashov* updated HA-650: Add ability to search by candidate name

bot [9:22 PM]
*dmabashov* updated HA-650: Add ability to search by candidate name

bot [9:22 PM]
*rob* updated HA-650: Add ability to search by candidate name
Fix versions: 2.1 -> 2.2

item.title: AIA-21: Include issue creation event into the list of changes for the issue
item.description:
Reporter Nikolay Chorniy (nikolay.chorniy@gma il.com)

Updated Aug 27, 2014 4:19:00 PM
Priority Normal
Type Task
State Open
Assignee Unassigned
Subsystem No subsystem
Fix versions 0.0.2
Affected versions Unknown
Fixed in build Next Build
Except all items represented by a <change> tag which represent issue edit we should include "issue creation event" as initial event for the issue. In order to do that we can parse <issue> tag contents of the "issue changes" API response:

<changes>

 </field>

 </field>
 <field xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:type="SingleField" name="reporterName">
 <value>justinbrooks</value>
 </field>
 <field xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:type="SingleField" name="reporterFullName">
 <value>Justin Brooks</value>
 </field>

I think we can probably hold fire on that until it is done. I am pretty sure we got held up waiting for something on it." shownForIssueAuthor="false" created="1405380835499">

Updated Aug 27, 2014 4:19:00 PM

Right now, we are converting all messages in the same way. We should make a simple converter, and then have the ability to have different converters for different event types.

item.title: AIA-15: System needs to skip over Events that cannot be parsed
item.description:
Reporter Rob Williams (rob)
Created Aug 22, 2014 12:30:41 PM
Updated Aug 27, 2014 4:19:00 PM
Priority Normal
Type Task
State Open
Assignee Unassigned
Subsystem No subsystem
Fix versions 0.0.2
Affected versions Unknown
Fixed in build Next Build
There are two keys aspects to this behavior:

  • make sure the rest of the events in the current fetch are processed
  • make sure that if we fail on an event that happens to be the last one, we don't resume with it next time and just fail again

Something simple here, a supervisor with a try block.

item.title: HA-675: Deleting or thumbs downing a lead from the workspace makes the lead disappear from the feed.
item.description:
Reporter Darren Mabashov (dmabashov)
Created Aug 21, 2014 10:52:16 AM
Updated Aug 27, 2014 3:36:16 PM
Priority Normal
Type Bug

Assignee Andrey Chorniy (andrey.chorniy)

Fix versions 2.2
Affected versions Unknown
Fixed in build Next Build
aggregatetimespent No aggregatetimespent
aggregatetimeestimate No aggregatetimeestimate
resolution No resolution
timespent No timespent
timeestimate No timeestimate
if a user presses the thumbs down button from their workspace or decides to trash a lead in their workspace the lead will disappear from the feed.

only leads that are trashed or thumbs downed directly on the feed should affect the feed. Leads that are thumbs downed or trashed in a users workspace should have no affect on the feed and therefore the ad should not disappear from the feed.

item.title: HA-682: No technology keywords should be used in querying job sites
item.description:
Reporter Rob Williams (rob)
Created Aug 26, 2014 3:51:23 PM
Updated Aug 26, 2014 3:51:23 PM
Priority Normal
Type Task
State Open
Assignee Unassigned
Subsystem No subsystem
Fix versions 2.2
Affected versions Unknown
Fixed in build Next Build
aggregatetimespent No aggregatetimespent
aggregatetimeestimate No aggregatetimeestimate
resolution No resolution
timespent No timespent
timeestimate No timeestimate
At the source level, we want to just focus on either categories (e.g. Programming, Network), or specific job titles. NO technology (e.g. PHP). Plain and simple.

Seems we have an issue with Indeed because they don't have categories. (And LinkedIn, but we found out that that's not even working right now (and of course we didn't know...).)

If there are exceptions, add them as subtasks and mark them as blocked.

This ticket is done when we are doing NO technology terms to sources.

It could be done by sending the search request and handling an error
App should get "SearchPhaseExecutionException" with phase = "query" in that case.

item.title: HA-678: Verify that application is collecting jobs for all cities within 31 miles from agency address
item.description:
Reporter Nikolay Chorniy (nikolay.chorniy@gma il.com)
Created Aug 25, 2014 7:00:37 AM
Updated Aug 26, 2014 11:22:02 AM
Priority Normal
Type Bug
State Open
Assignee Unassigned
Subsystem No subsystem
Fix versions 2.2
Affected versions Unknown
Fixed in build Next Build
aggregatetimespent No aggregatetimespent
aggregatetimeestimate No aggregatetimeestimate
resolution No resolution
timespent No timespent
timeestimate No timeestimate
For sources which can get State name as location, application is scraping new jobs for that state. In case if source does not support "state location" request, application collects all agency cities and performs scraping requests on "per-city" level. However some nearby cities may not be included in that list. We should address this problem so that all nearby cities are included.
